name: Trigger Finger (Stenosing Tenosynovitis)
chief_complaint: My finger keeps getting stuck when I try to straighten it, and it hurts when it pops free
symptoms: Finger catching or locking when bent
Pain at the base of the affected finger
Tenderness or a small lump in the palm
physical_findings: Snapping or popping sensation with finger motion
Limited range of motion in affected digit
treatment: Percutaneous or open surgical release for refractory cases
prognosis: Excellent with treatment; most patients achieve full resolution of symptoms
description: A condition where one of the fingers gets stuck in a bent position and then straightens with a snap (like a trigger being pulled and released). Caused by inflammation narrowing the space within the sheath that surrounds the tendon in the affected finger.
